alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 5:30AM AKST until December 13 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Shishmaref and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition to reducing visibility, strong winds and waves could also lead to heavy freezing spray which may create light ice accumulations on surfaces.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
